items.title: A way to automatically generate regexes from examples
items.content:
#â€‹602 â€” August 12, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

â˜€ï¸ We're taking a rare week off next week for a brief summer vacation so there won't be any issue on August 19 â€“ we'll be back on August 26, complete with a sun tan wind burn, and all the latest JavaScript news, of course :-)
__
Peter Cooper, your editor.

JavaScript Weekly

Code Golfing Tips and Tricks for Smaller JavaScriptÂ Code â€” Writing code thatâ€™s as terse as possible isnâ€™t usually desirable â€“ it's not fun for your coworkers, and your build process might minify your code anyway! But if you need to squeeze into as few characters as possible and some messiness is tolerable.. this is a thorough list of ideas and a learning experience in its ownÂ right! (Quite a few of these come from this classic "byte saving techniques" page, BTW.)

Ciprian

Astro 1.0: The Fast Islands-Based Frontend Framework â€” Despite its relative youth, Astro has had a big impact already with a wide range of users and support for, well, almost every other framework or dev tool going. It's based around â€˜islandsâ€™ where fast HTML can stand in for components which can then be lazily loaded in as user interactions demand. 1.0 introduces new image and picture components, MDX/Markdown support, and SSR builds. Thereâ€™s a new homepageÂ too.

Fred Schott

Add Excel-Like Spreadsheet Experiences to Your JS Apps â€” SpreadJS is the industry-leading JavaScript spreadsheet for adding advanced spreadsheet features to your enterprise apps. Build finance, analysis, budget, and other apps. Excel I/O, 500+ calc functions, tables, charts, and more. View demosÂ now.

SpreadJS from GrapeCity sponsor

Patterns.dev: Modern Web App Design Patterns â€” A free book you can download in PDF format or enjoy on the Web. Learn about lots of fundamentals, from how different styles of rendering or importing resources work to performance optimizations and case studies. Thereâ€™s a lot to enjoy and a fantastic team behind it, too.

Lydia Hallie, Addy Osmani, and Others

IN BRIEF:

  • Three months on from 4.7, TypeScript 4.8 is now in release candidate stage. Most of the enhancements relate to inference, type narrowing, and fileÂ watching.

  • ğŸ”’ GitHub is proposing to use SigStore as a way for users and tools to verify npm package provenance as a way to improveÂ security.

  • The â–¶ï¸ latest episode of the TC39er podcast features an interview with Bloomberg's Robin Ricard, known for his work on the Records and Tuples proposal.

  • Lizz Parody walks us through the proposal to support type annotations within JavaScript code (yes, not TypeScript!)

RELEASES:

Playwright 1.25.0 â€“ Browser remote control and runner toolkit.
Lerna 5.4 â€“ Build system for multiple JS projects in one repo.
Fastify 4.4 â€“ Fast, low overhead web framework.
NodeBB 2.4 â€“ Node.js based forum software.
Color.js 0.4 â€“ Color conversion & manipulation library.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

'How and Why We Removed jQuery from GOV.UK' â€” Weâ€™ve mentioned the UK government digital teamâ€™s culling of jQuery in passing a few times this year, but now thereâ€™s a (brief) explanation of how itÂ happened.

Andy Sellick (GDS)

How To Use Multithreading in Node.js â€” A practical walkthrough to how Node uses threads and how and why you might use worker threads yourself in a webÂ app.

Stanley Ulili (for DigitalOcean)

How to Monitor a Node.js Application â€” Set up monitoring for an open source application with New Relic using instant observability for Node.jsÂ quickstart.

New Relic sponsor

â–¶Â Â Record and Tuple: Immutable Data Structures in JS â€” A JSNation 2022 talk looking at the motivation behind a proposal currently advancing through TC39. (22Â minutes.)

Robin Ricard

Modelling Stable Fluids with Three.js â€” Math, math, shaders, and moreÂ math.

Misaki Nakano

Will Bun Take Node's Crown? â€” Another comparison.
Tomas Fernandez opinion

â–¶Â Â Let's Build Tetris: A Multi-Part Series
Joe Boyle

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Grex: A Way to Generate Regular Expressions from ProvidedÂ Examples â€” This demo is quite fun to play with. Grex is a Rust-based improvement of a JavaScript project which, by way of WebAssembly can be used from JavaScript once again. Itâ€™s quite a neat idea and while itâ€™s not perfect, it can provide you with some inspiration for crafting regexes. GitHubÂ repo.

Peter M. Stahl

Cloudscape: AWS's React Component Design System â€” Built for and used by Amazon Web Services, you get 66 components, opinionated guides on design best practices, and manyÂ demos.

Amazon Web Services

Donâ€™t Let Your Issue Tracker Be a Four-Letter Word. Use Shortcut â€” The best issue tracking software is one that software developers are actually happy toÂ use.

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

Million 1.12: A Fast and Small Virtual DOM Implementation â€” Focused on performance and shipping at under 1KB compressed, Million is ideal if you want an agnostic VDOM implementation to use when building your own framework or just to go a little lower level. â€œThink of it as if Reactâ€™s API and Svelteâ€™s compiler had aÂ baby.â€

Million

React Rating: Easy Star Ratings Component â€” SVG-based. No dependencies. Check out the many examples to see if it gets your â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

Simone Mastromattei

Size Limit 8.0: Performance Budgeting Tool for JavaScript â€” Calculate the real â€˜costâ€™ to run your JS app or lib to maintain an eye on performance and raise an error (in CI, say) when things go awry. Supports ES modules and treeÂ shaking.

Andrey Sitnik

svg2pdf.js: Browser Based SVG to PDF Converter â€” Thereâ€™s an online playground to give you a feel for what it canÂ do.

yWorks GmbH

brotli-wasm: Brotli Compressor and Decompressor â€” Covers both Node and the browser by means ofÂ WebAssembly.

HTTP Toolkit

Never Code an Email API Template Again

Courier.com sponsor

Grakkit: A Modern JS Dev Environment for Minecraft â€” Brings together JS and Minecraft by way ofÂ GraalVM.

Grakkit Project

React Colorful 5.6: A Small Color Picker Component for (P)react â€” Nice demo that changes the color of theÂ homepage.
Vlad Shilov

React DayPicker v8: A Date Picker Component
Giampaolo Bellavite

string-left-right: Find the First Non-Whitespace Character to the Left or Right of aÂ GivenÂ Index
Roy Revelt

OTHER QUICK RELEASES:

Jayson 4.0 â€“ JSON-RPC client/server for Node.
vite-plugin-eslint 1.8 â€“ ESLint plugin for Vite.
Faker 7.4 â€“ Generate massive amounts of fake data.
COBE 0.6 â€“ 5KB WebGL globe lib. (Demo.)
html-to-image 1.10 â€“ Generate images from DOM nodes.
Juice 8.1 â€“ Inlines CSS stylesheets into your HTML source.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Node.js Developer (Remote or Warsaw) â€” Join our backend team responsible for CKEditor Cloud Services and develop an Open Source product used by millions of usersÂ worldwide.
CKEditor

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ˜® WOW OF THE WEEK

If you've got a few minutes, â–¶ï¸ this video of a recent winning 'demo' from a demoscene contest is pretty mindblowing.

The code was written in 2022, but is running on a 1981 IBM PC using CGA graphics and if you're old enough to have used such a machine (like me!) it's amazing what they've managed to squeeze out of it. As one commenter (Jeff Haluska) said: "I have been programming for about 25 years and Area 5150 has me questioning everything I know about computers."

items.title: Genius misuse of WOFF 2 and Brotli to win a JavaScript contest.
items.content:
#â€‹601 â€” August 5, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

JS1024 2022 Competition Winners â€” JS1024 is an annual â€˜code golfingâ€™ contest where you get 15 days to create a cool JavaScript or GLSL program within 1024 bytes. Naturally this brings out a lot of creativity and trickery, but also amazing (non-minified) source to check out. The winning JS entry is this quirky typing game and the winner shader is a sinister 3D tunnel experience. Thereâ€™s a lot to look through and learn from because these developers are using every trick in theÂ book, including compressing 1900+ English words into one of the entries..!

JS1024

Docusaurus 2.0 Released â€” Docusaurus powered sites are everywhere in the JS space lately (look at the Babel docs, for example), and after four years of effort, version 2.0 of the popular React-powered documentation-focused static site generator has landed. This new version was rebuilt from scratch, and adds MDX support, a new plugin system, theming, dark mode, SPA navigation, offline support, andÂ more.

Meta (Facebook)

Announcing EdgeDB 2.0 â€” Try the database that makes ORMs obsolete. EdgeDBâ€™s TypeScript client has the simplicity of an ORM but the power of a full-fledged query language. And with the release of EdgeDB 2.0 itâ€™s better than everâ€”read the announcement forÂ details.

EdgeDB sponsor

Electron 20: The Cross Platform Desktop App Platform â€” As much as 20 sounds like a substantial, round version number, itâ€™s mostly a typical release. Chromium gets bumped up to v104, V8 to 10.4, and Node to 16.15.0. Windows gains an â€˜immersive dark modeâ€™ and itâ€™s now possible for Electron windows to â€˜floatâ€™ over full-screen appsÂ panel-style.

Charles Kerr

IN BRIEF:

  • ğŸ” npm query is a new command in the latest version of npm that lets you query your project's dependencies using a CSS-like selector format.

  • Remember the guy who built JavaScript games using Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint as a canvas? He's back building â–¶ï¸ a multiplayer game in Word. Just 3-minutes and wonderfully wacky.

  • There's a new VS Code release and while the JS debugging features see improvements, â–¶ï¸ this 'sticky scrolling' feature is particularly neat as it keeps your function signatures on screen even during longÂ functions.

  • If you use AWS's Lambda serverless platform for running your functions and you use it a lot, their new tiered pricing structure may yield some big savings.

RELEASES:

Parcel 2.7
Ionic 6.2 â€“ Cross-platform app building toolkit.
Redwood 2.2 â€“ React-backed full-stack framework.
Cypress 10.4 â€“ Popular testing approach for anything browser-based.
Ohm 16.4 â€“ Parser / interpreter building toolkit.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Checking if Native JavaScript Functions are 'Monkey Patched' â€” Along with JavaScriptâ€™s dynamism comes the potential for functions to be overridden (or â€˜monkey patchedâ€™, as some people call the idea of runtime modifications) but there are (imperfect) ways to see if this hasÂ occurred.

Matteo Mazzarolo

On Building Modern Webapps Faster with Bud â€” Bud (no, not Bun) is a relatively new Go(lang) and JavaScript powered full-stack web framework with a lot of good ideas â€“ â–¶ï¸ this 15-minute video on creating a Hacker News clone with it is a fun demo. If Go works for you on the backend, it's worth aÂ look.

Preslav Rachev

Level-Up Your Cypress Testing Knowledge for Free â€” Learn from top industry experts with over 25 lessons on how to get started withÂ Cypress.

Cypress.io sponsor

From 500ms to 1.7ms in React â€” A sluggish customized grid triggered a journey to analyze some bottlenecks, followed by some tweaks resulting in a dramatic perfÂ improvement.

Oren Farhi

Parsing Command Line Arguments with util.parseArgs() inÂ Node.js â€” A feature added in Node 18.3, just thisÂ year.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Use Jest to Replace Default Test Runners in an Angular Project
Rob Bell

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

vue-grid-layout: Draggable and Resizable Grid Layout for Vue.js â€” Like Gridster.js (from the jQuery days!) , but for Vue.js. Thereâ€™s a demo right on the homepage. GitHubÂ repo.

JBay Solutions

safe-json-value: For When JSON Serialization Mustn't Fail â€” Prevents JSON.serialize() from throwing an exeception, changing types, or otherwise transforming values unexpectedly, because sometimes you need that sort ofÂ reassurance.

ehmicky

Quokka.js Is the #1 JavaScript / TypeScript Scratchpad for VS Code â€” Ideal for exploring and testing JavaScript. Code runs immediately as you type with feedback right next to yourÂ code.

Wallaby.js sponsor

colorgrad: High-Perf, Rust-Powered Color Gradient Library â€” Uses Rust compiled to WebAssembly behind the scenes â€“ very modern! Itâ€™s also a nice small codebase with which to learn the technique if you want to try it too. LiveÂ demo.

Nor Khasyatillah

Embla Carousel 7: Carousel with Fluid Motion and 'Swipe Precision' â€” A much maligned UI element, but the examples worked pretty well for us. Library agnostic but has easy integrations for React, Vue, and Svelte, if you needÂ them.

David Jerleke

Nativefier: Make Any Web Page a Desktop App â€” A basic Node.js-powered tool for creating a desktop â€˜appâ€™ for any Web site using Electron as the webview. For Windows, macOS andÂ Linux.

Goh Jia Hao

ts-version: Access the Current TypeScript Version from Types â€” The creator puts it best: â€œFrustrated how TS versions handle your package slightly differently, but donâ€™t want to ship a full copy of your types with TypesVersions? Now you can adjust your types depending on the TSÂ version!â€

Lenz Weber-Tronic

Integrate eSignatures in Your App in Less Than a Week

HelloSign, a Dropbox Company sponsor

PowerGlitch: A Tiny Library to 'Glitch' Images on the Web
PowerHat

OTHER QUICK RELEASES:

React Native Boilerplate 3.5 â€“ A starter template for RN apps.
Stripe Node 10.0 â€“ Node.js library for Stripe's API.
Electron Store 8.1 â€“ Simple data persistence for Electron apps.
Meriyah 4.3 â€“ Compliant, self-hosted JS parser. (Demo)
React Spreadsheet Grid 2.3 â€“ Excel-like grid component for React.
Inferno 8.0.2 â€“ Fast, React-like library.
âˆ¿ Peaks.js 2.0.3 â€“ BBC's audio waveform UI component.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior JavaScript Developer (Warsaw or Remote) ğŸ‡µğŸ‡± ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ â€” Open Source rich text editor used by millions of users around the world. Strong focus on code quality. Join the CKEditorÂ team.
CKEditor

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

â“ Did you know..

  • There's a useful curated list of over 150 static site generators and relatedÂ resources? If you want to cast a wider net and stretch the SSG definition a little, here are hundredsÂ more.

  • On macOS, if you hold down Option (âŒ¥) when resizing a window, it resizes from all directions at once? Handy for those windows that wander offÂ screen.

  • ğŸ¶ Rewarding a dog for rescuing people in danger can have unintended negativeÂ consequences?

Goh Jia Hao 


  
  
ts-version: Access the Current TypeScript Version from Types â€” The creator puts it best: â€œFrustrated how TS versions handle your package slightly differently, but donâ€™t want to ship a full copy of your types with TypesVersions? Now you can adjust your types depending on the TSÂ version!â€
Lenz Weber-Tronic 


  
  
Integrate eSignatures in Your App in Less Than a Week
HelloSign, a Dropbox Company sponsor


  
PowerGlitch: A Tiny Library to 'Glitch' Images on the Web
  
PowerHat 
  


OTHER QUICK RELEASES:
React Native Boilerplate 3.5 â€“ A starter template for RN apps.
Stripe Node 10.0 â€“ Node.js library for Stripe's API.
Electron Store 8.1 â€“ Simple data persistence for Electron apps.
Meriyah 4.3 â€“ Compliant, self-hosted JS parser. (Demo)
React Spreadsheet Grid 2.3 â€“ Excel-like grid component for React.
Inferno 8.0.2 â€“ Fast, React-like  library.
âˆ¿ Peaks.js 2.0.3 â€“ BBC's audio waveform UI component.








ğŸ’» Jobs





  
Senior JavaScript Developer (Warsaw or Remote) ğŸ‡µğŸ‡± ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ â€” Open Source rich text editor used by millions of users around the world. Strong focus on code quality. Join the CKEditorÂ team.
  
CKEditor 
  


  
Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
  
Hired 
  










â“ Did you know..
There's a useful curated list of over 150 static site generators and relatedÂ resources? If you want to cast a wider net and stretch the SSG definition a little, here are hundredsÂ more.
On macOS, if you hold down Option (âŒ¥) when resizing a window, it resizes from all directions at once? Handy for those windows that wander offÂ screen.
ğŸ¶ Rewarding a dog for rescuing people in danger can have unintended negativeÂ consequences?

items.title: Douglas Crockford on 'retiring' JavaScript
items.content:
#â€‹600 â€” July 29, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Roll Your Own JavaScript Runtime â€” Bun, Rhino, Deno, Node, and now Blueboat.. is creating your own JavaScript runtime environment the new â€œhello worldâ€? ğŸ˜† Not quite, but this is a fun walk through the bare basics of the process, and youâ€™ll have a Rust, Tokio and V8 powered system of your own by the end ofÂ it.

Bartek IwaÅ„czuk

Bun: A Complete Overhaul of the JavaScript Ecosystem? â€” Continuing on the JavaScript runtime theme, Forrest takes a thoughtful look at Bun, its promises, and potential. While itâ€™s â€œstill not quite ready for the workplace,â€ he concludes there are clearly good timesÂ ahead.

Forrest Allison

Add Professional Scheduling Components to Your Web App â€” Save development time with Bryntum's web component suite. The UI library includes fully customizable Gantt, scheduler, calendar, data grid and Kanban board widgets. Integrate with React, Vue, Angular or vanilla js. Download a free 45-dayÂ trial.

Bryntum sponsor

Douglas Crockford: "The best thing we can do today to JavaScript is to retire it." â€” Ouch! An interview with the author of JavaScript: The Good Parts and sort-of-inventor of JSON where he explains the benefits of code reading, why we need better languages, and how he wonâ€™t â€œwrite about JavaScriptÂ again.â€ What about TypeScriptÂ then?Â ğŸ˜

Evrone

15 Common Beginner JavaScript Mistakes â€” James puts out a lot of fantastic JavaScript videos on his YouTube channel, but I asked him to write an article instead because I knew more people would read it ;-) And he did!

James Quick

IN BRIEF:

  • Wikimedia wikis (including Wikipedia) now play their videos with Video.js â€“ here's the full story.

  • The TC39er podcast is back after a few months' rest with â–¶ï¸ an interview with Luca Casonato of the Deno core team â€“ they discuss Deno, TC39, and favorite language proposals.

  • âš›ï¸ Max Rozen has collected together examples of larger production-grade open source React apps to dig into and learn from.

  • GitHub has rolled out more npm security enhancements with improvements to login and publishing, the ability to connect GitHub and Twitter accounts to npm, and a new npm audit signatures command for verifying package integrity.

  • ğŸ–¼ A sneak peek at how Storybook 7.0 is going to look.

RELEASES:

Impress.js 2.0 â€“ JS + CSS3 powered presentation framework.
Lerna 5.3 â€“ Manage and publish multiple packages from a monorepo.
Ghost 5.5 â€“ Node.js CMS / publishing platform.
Mongoose 6.5 â€“ Node.js MongoDB object modeling.
NodeBB 2.3 â€“ Node.js based forum software.
Jasmine 4.3 â€“ Popular JS testing framework.
Node.js 18.7.0

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Everything You Need to Know About Import Maps â€” Import maps provide a way to control the behavior of JavaScript imports so even something as simple as import moment from "moment" on a Web page could pull in the right code. Theyâ€™re beginning to be used in more places despite a lack of official Firefox or Safari support yet (though polyfills areÂ available).

Ayooluwa Isaiah

Misko Hevery on Why Qwik Will Improve JavaScript Frameworks â€” Angularâ€™s original creator Misko Hevery says his new project answers a long-standing problem: Qwik is a JavaScript framework that promises â€˜instantâ€™ apps. I watched his introductory presentation the other day and it wasÂ convincing.

Starr Campbell (The New Stack)

Stytch Is Building Your All-In-One Platform for User Authentication

Stytch sponsor

ğŸª„ Â Extract Parameter Types from String Literal Types with TypeScript â€” If the things that TypeScriptâ€™s type system can do impress or confuse you, this well presented article will give you a turbocharged dose ofÂ either..!

Tan Li Hau

Deeper Testing of Bun's Performance and Compatibility Against Node â€” We recently linked to Davidâ€™s initial Node vs Bun comparison but had to issue a correction due to a flaw in the methodology. Luckily, David is now revisiting the idea with â€œsome more carefully constructed performance testsâ€.

David Herron

Donâ€™t Let Your Issue Tracker Be a Four-Letter Word. Use Shortcut

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

Creating ESM-Based Shell Scripts for Unix and Windows with Node.js â€” Dr. Axel has figured out all the tricks involved and boiled it down into a tightÂ post.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Writing a Fuzzy Search Component with Preact and Fuse for Astro
Lloyd Atkinson

'Notes From My Journey From Rust to... TypeScript??' â€” It's not all one way traffic.
Glauber Costa

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Blueboat: An All-in-One Serverless JavaScript Runtime â€” If youâ€™ve used Cloudflare Workers, the idea will seem familiar. It ties together V8, process level snapshots and Rust to focus on running JavaScript in multi-tenant style safely andÂ quickly.

Heyang Zhou

Skeleton: A Full Featured Svelte UI Component Library â€” Svelte + Tailwind makes a skeleton very happy. Lots of docs and demosÂ here.

Brain and Bones, LLC

Stream Is The #1 Chat API for Custom Messaging Apps â€” Streamâ€™s Chat API & SDKs enable teams to add fully-featured in-app messaging in days - apply for your Maker Account, free for qualifyingÂ teams.

Stream sponsor

simplex-noise.js 4.0: A Fast Simplex Noise Implementation â€” Small, self contained, and fast, and you can use it in cool demos like this or for applying convincing grain/noise to images or other data, say.

Jonas Wagner

AST Explorer: Analyze the Structure of Parsed JavaScript Online â€” A neat little Web-based tool to see how supplied JavaScript code gets parsed into a syntaxÂ tree.

Felix Kling

OTHER QUICK RELEASES:

Article Parser 7.0 â€“ Extract article content from a given URL in Node.
React Simple Maps 3.0 â€“ Beautiful SVG maps for React apps.
Emoji Mart 5.2 â€“ Emoji picking component.
hls.js 1.2 â€“ JS lib to play HTTP Live Streaming content.
MicroDiff 1.3 â€“ Zero dependency object and array comparison library.
Temporal JavaScript SDK 1.0 â€“ Durable code execution framework & platform.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Software Engineers â€” Sticker Mule is the Internet's most "kick ass" brand. Our software team operates from 17 countries, and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Sticker mule

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

â“ Did you know..

  • ğŸ‘´ğŸ» When JavaScript Weekly started in November 2010 â€“ 600 issues ago now â€“ Barack Obama was serving his first term, the iPad was less then a year old, and Express had just beenÂ released. I wonder what will be going on when issue 1000Â arrives..

items.title: Common JavaScript issues developers face
items.content:
#â€‹599 â€” July 22, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

RedwoodJS vs. Blitz.js: The Future of Fullstack Meta-Frameworks â€” Quite a lengthy review of both frameworks. Redwood is an opinionated React-based framework oriented heavily round the idea of a GraphQL server as the â€˜one APIâ€™ at the heart of an app. Blitz, on the other hand, is a Ruby on Rails-inspired layer on top of Next.js with SPA, server side rendering and static site generationÂ chops. Don't forget Remix too.. this is a busyÂ space!

Tamas Kadlecsik

Ten Common JavaScript Issues Developers Face â€” If youâ€™ve been working with JavaScript for many years (perhaps since 2014 when this newly-updated article was first penned), these are potholes you (probably) already know how to steer around, but thereâ€™s plenty to chew on hereÂ otherwise.

Ryan J. Peterson

CSS Animations and Transitions â€” Join David Khourshid on this detailed video course and discover how to bring your interfaces to life with UI animations. Learn about CSS transitions, keyframes, custom properties, choreography, animation states, and muchÂ more

Frontend Masters sponsor

Reducing the Size of a Large JavaScript SDK Package by 29% â€” After some comments on how large their JavaScript package was getting, developers at Sentry (an app monitoring service) set to work trying to get an initial 30% reduction. Tree shaking turned out to have the biggestÂ effect.

Abhijeet Prasad (Sentry)

Payload 1.0: A Headless CMS Platform Built on Node â€” An exciting project that appeared in early 2021 with a bang then became open source just a couple of months ago. Thereâ€™s a lot to like about Payload if you need a headless CMS including a customizable React-based admin system, GraphQL or REST APIs, flexible auth and file upload systems, and itâ€™s easy to get started. GitHubÂ repo.

Payload CMS

IN BRIEF:

  • UPDATE / ERROR: Last week we linked to a comparison of Bun and Node.js's performance but, as is often the case with benchmarks, there was a flaw: Node.js was being run in both cases! ğŸ˜¬ We await further results. Thanks to Craig Doremus for letting us know.

  • Hemanth HM presents a quick update from the 91st TC39 meeting where several language proposals wereÂ advanced.

  • Hermes is a JS engine built by Facebook primarily for use in React Native and, curiously, it was possible to misuse its quicksort implementation to run the classic FPS DOOM â€“ a bug resulting in a $12k bounty payout.

  • ğŸ“Š A data-driven attempt to compare the popularity of React, Angular, Angular.js, Vue and Svelte. Spoiler: React sits on top.

RELEASES:

NeutralinoJS 4.7.0 â€“ Lightweight cross platform apps with JS & HTML.
npm-check 6.0 â€“ Check for outdated or unused dependencies.
Fastify 4.3 â€“ Fast Node.js web framework.
ESLint 8.20
Angular 14.1
Vue 2.7.8
.. and more releases at end of this issue.

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

Thoughts on Integer Math in JavaScript â€” No concrete examples here but if fast integer math is something you need, you could do worse than to build upon Jamesâ€™ thinking (to which he hopes to write a more completeÂ follow-up).

James Darpinian

JavaScript Obfuscation Techniques by Example â€” The Hacker News discussion around this article was, perhaps, even more interesting, IÂ thought.

Trickster Dev

10 npm Security Best Practices

Snyk.io sponsor

JavaScript AST Manipulation with Babel: The First Steps â€” From the same author as the item on obfuscation (above) comes a look at the basics of using Babel to turn obfuscated code into a syntax tree and then back into more readableÂ JavaScript.

Trickster Dev

â–¶Â Â An Introduction to SvelteKit in 80 Minutes â€” Svelte is an increasingly popular way to build reactive frontend apps and SvelteKit provides a framework and more complete development experience around Svelte. Nacho gives us aÂ tour.

Nacho Falk

â–¶Â Â Blazingly Fast 'React' with Fresh â€” One of the most popular React YouTubers out there heads Deno-side to look at Fresh, a new islands-based web framework that doesnâ€™t use React per se but.. close enough, with Preact and JSX for rendering andÂ templating.

Jack Herrington

2022 State of the Java Ecosystem Report â€” New Relicâ€™s report is based on data gathered from millions of applications providing performanceÂ data.

New Relic sponsor

Converting Cypress E2E Specs from JavaScript to TypeScript â€” More to it than you mightÂ expect.
Gleb Bahmutov

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Tweakpane 3.1: Compact UI Element for Tweaking Parameters and Viewing ValueÂ Changes â€” This is the sort of thing you see in creative coding demos quite often, but could be used almost anywhere. You can create your own mini pane of basic UI controls to dynamically adjust (or just reflect) values relating to something going on on the page. Itâ€™s simple and looks great, and if you want a demo, thenâ€¦

cocopon

Fireworks.js 2.0: It's Literally Fireworks for Your Web Page â€” Well, literally in a visual sense at least ;-) The homepage is a neat demo given you can dynamically play around with all of the libraryâ€™s parameters (courtesy of Tweakpane, mentioned above!)

Vitalij Ryndin

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is the Future â€” 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints and console.log, now with support forÂ Vitest.

Wallaby.js sponsor

Superstate: A New 'Micro' State Management Library â€” So micro, even, that the getting started tutorial takes all of 30 seconds to read. GitHubÂ repo.

Guilherme Oderdenge

TanStack Table v8: Headless UI for Building Tables and Datagrids â€” Want the hard work of managing a table or data grid element taken care of but want to keep 100% control over markup and styles? This is what you need (if the idea of a â€˜headless UIâ€™ is new to you, read this intro). Vanilla JS, React, Vue, Solid and Svelte developers are all taken careÂ of.

Tanner Linsley

Atropos: Create Touch-Friendly 3D Parallax Hover Effects â€” Use with plain JS, React, or Vue and itâ€™s easy to configure with no dependencies. The home page includes some quite striking examples that arenâ€™t as over the top as youâ€™dÂ expect.

Vladimir Kharlampidi

OTHER QUICK RELEASES:

PrimeNG 14 â€“ Suite of 80+ Angular UI components.
Acorn 8.8 â€“ Tiny JS parser written in pure JS.
Discord.ts 10.0 â€“ Framework to create a Discord chat bot.
Prisma 4.1 â€“ Popular ORM for Node.js and TypeScript.
MelonJS 13.0 â€“ 2D sprite-based JS game engine.
Secure Electron Template 20.0 â€“ An Electron boilerplate app.
zip.js 2.6.2 â€“ Zip and unzip files in the browser or Deno.
Octokit.js 2.0.4 â€“ GitHub SDK for browsers, Node, and Deno.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Software Engineers â€” Sticker Mule is the Internet's most "kick ass" brand. Our software team operates from 17 countries, and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Sticker mule

Attend Our July 27th 2022 State of Wage Inequality in Tech Discussion â€” Join Hired, Blacks in Technology, Adaâ€™s List, Interview Kickstart, and Speak_ for a collaborative panel discussion about Hiredâ€™s 2022 Impact of Wage Inequality dataÂ report.
Hired

â“ Did you know..

  • ... there's a fully open source online MIDI editor called Signal? Quite fun to compose with (or, in my case, just scribble notesÂ over).
  • ... Smashing Magazine has done a roundup of image compression and optimization tools? Mostly online, but some local ones too.
  • ... there's a Web site that satirizes the modern Web browsing experience? Amazing and dispiriting in equal measure.
  • ... ğŸŒ† you can create a miniature 3D 'city' of your GitHub contributions?
  • ... we have ğŸ’Œ a Node.js newsletter too?
